info.name: Dark Night Feedly (wide/condensed)
info.description: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ Update for Feedly Dark Mode ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ Feedly finally added a native Dark Mode. That allow me to remove an lot of code not anymore necessary. Like the title suggests, this is a simple dark (or night) style that uses an almost black color for the background and white/green for RSS content and other text elements. I tried also to reduced the unused space and to make fit better on Full HD and 4K screens. I'll tune this style to target my personal tastes, but I would try to implement any good suggestion you want to provide me. ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ Tested both on Firefox and Chrome extension ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ If you like the style, you can offer me a coffee ‚òï or a beer üç∫ using the Pledge button below! Thank you!
info.additionalInfo:
1.29 - 2019/09/08
- Remove a lot of code not necessary anymore thanks to Feedly new dark mode feature

1.28 - 2017/07/12
+ Set floating header bar widht full screen
- Removed external inclusion of FontAwesome.css
- Removed old unused embedded images
- Removed all unused references to PhotoBucket external files
x Fixed user profile menu background 
x Fixed custom menu background
x Fixed other menu background
x Fixed metadata green color
x Fixed RSS icon color
x Other minor fixes

1.27 - 2017/07/11
+ Added support to user preference settings tabs
% Change "green" color to Feedly official color

1.26 - 2017/07/11
x Fixed regression on magazine view of button and icon colors
+ Code improvements

1.25 - 2017/07/11
x Fixed layout button style after Feedly update
+ Improved style of some icons and removed unnecessary code

1.24 - 2017/06/17
x Urgent fix of background color
x Floating header background color fix

1.23 - 2017/05/09
+ Improved cards view: now uses always 6 fixed columns
+ Increased section title in card view

1.22 - 2017/05/04

+ Increased some font sizes
Chrome 58 changes font rendering behavior on some screen DPI and I discovered that I didn't fix some font size and with this change I am trying to avoid to have too small font for readability.
Let me have your feedback
